chapter.title: Download
chapter.para: Before you begin, download binaries for Federate Embedded. Note that there are three different artifacts are available for download.

listitem.para: Federate Source - contains all the source code for all modules
Federate Binary - contains all the binary code for all modules
Federate Embedded Kit - contains only required modules and their required 3rd party dependencies

chapter.para: Download Federate Embedded Kit and expand this tar/zip file in a known accessible location.

In the expanded directory, you will find "federate-${version}-embedded.jar" which is the required binary jar file for Federate Embedded and all the files under the "lib" directory are supporting 3rd party binaries required to execute Federate Embedded. Later sections will go in detail about installing these artifacts.

In the expanded directory, you will find "federate-${version}-embedded.jar", which is the main binary jar file for Federate Embedded, and the "lib" directory containing supporting 3rd party binaries required to execute Federate Embedded.

note.para: Access to the physical data sources such as Oracle, MS-SQL Server, DB2, and Sybase through Federate relies upon user supplying their own JDBC drivers in the deployment. Open source JDBC drivers for MySQL, Postgres, and Derby were already included in the "lib" folder as the LGPL license permits them. However, Federate code base has been tested extensively with DataDirect JDBC Drivers and for your convenience DataDirect drivers are available through this site to be used with your Federate Embedded application. Note that you would have agree for separate licensing terms set forth by DataDirect before you use them. For more information and directions to download check out DataDirect driver download
